propositions.text: Ancient civilizations with extraordinary advancements often faced destruction.
More advanced ancient civilizations, such as Atlantis and Mohenjo-daro, suffered more severe destruction.
Civilizations like the ancient Chinese and European ones, which were influential and contributed to the modern world, did not experience this phenomenon.
Professor Tony Sherman of Edinburgh University is a leading authority on this mysterious phenomenon.
Professor Sherman is Jiang Wuwei's mentor and a renowned archaeologist specializing in prehistoric civilizations.
Jiang Wuwei, a diligent student, assists Professor Sherman with his research.
Professor Sherman entrusts Jiang Wuwei with retrieving academic works from the library.
Jiang Wuwei accidentally discovers a hidden passage in Professor Sherman's study.
A bookcase slides open, revealing a hidden door.
Professor Sherman emerges from the hidden passage, surprising Jiang Wuwei.
Professor Sherman advises Jiang Wuwei on his graduation thesis.
The thesis is about the relationship between Chinese Taoist mystic culture and ancient world civilizations.
Professor Sherman suggests that Jiang Wuwei's thesis lacks personal experience and recommends field research for all ancient civilizations discussed.
A mysterious event occurs in Westport, New York.
Police sirens break the morning quiet as a police car speeds towards the outskirts.
Residents are accustomed to minor incidents, unaware of the impending disaster.
Westport is a wealthy town known for its beauty and proximity to New York City.
A prominent local figure, the 'Wise Prophet,' is a renowned astrologer.
The Wise Prophet is a descendant of Native Americans and follows the teachings of Edgar Cayce.
Edgar Cayce was a famous American psychic known for his healing and prophecy abilities.
The Wise Prophet has a unique rule: only one divination per day, after sunset.
The Wise Prophet is found dead in his study under bizarre circumstances.
His black maid discovers him sitting in a peculiar pose with a strange smile and black skin.
The maid's scream alerts the authorities.
Police arrive and are struck by the 'death smile' and unusual posture.
The death of the Wise Prophet triggers a wider crisis.
The maid and the responding police officers also die of respiratory failure, with their skin turning black.
Forensic examination reveals the cause of death is a novel virus.
New York goes on high alert, and Westport is quarantined.
International agencies are alerted to the unfolding crisis.
The CDC suspects a terrorist incident and reports to the White House.
Interpol and WHO also receive reports and initiate investigations.
A similar incident occurs in Hong Kong.
Two individuals in hazmat suits infiltrate a secluded villa in Deep Water Bay.
The resident of the villa is Ms. Wen Yan, a renowned TCM expert and guardian of a secret.
The intruders confront Ms. Wen Yan, demanding the secret she guards.
They reveal she is the 65th generation guardian of a secret that has been kept for 2000 years.
One of the intruders injects Ms. Wen Yan with an unknown virus.
Ms. Wen Yan faces a dilemma regarding the secret.
She realizes the virus is potent and potentially a global disaster.
She decides to leave a clue for Jiang Wuwei, a student of her late husband.
She writes a cryptic message on a prescription pad before succumbing to the virus.
Interpol agents Si Ling and Feng Zhicheng are assigned to the Hong Kong case.
They learn about the severe outbreak in New York and the potential connection.
Si Ling recognizes the victim as Wen Yan, the wife of the murdered archaeologist Ouyang Mingbo.
The Hong Kong crime scene mirrors the New York incident.
Wen Yan is found with a 'death smile' and in a seated posture.
The intruders destroyed surveillance footage.
The investigators find Wen Yan's cryptic message.
The message contains a symbol (infinity), Chinese characters ('盗墓'), numbers (2, 3, 7, 9), and a phrase ('玄鸟至').
Si Ling suspects Jiang Wuwei can decipher the message.
The virus is identified as a novel strain, causing a global health emergency.
The US enters its highest state of alert since WWII.
Si Ling intuitively predicts the next outbreak might be in the UK.
The two killers arrive in London.
They are heading towards an old apartment building near Waterloo Station.

concepts.name: Ancient Civilizations
concepts.context: Discussion of advanced ancient civilizations and their fate.

concepts.name: Destruction
concepts.context: The fate of advanced ancient civilizations and the fate of victims of the virus.

concepts.name: Professor Tony Sherman
concepts.context: Archaeologist, mentor to Jiang Wuwei, researching historical mysteries.

concepts.name: Jiang Wuwei
concepts.context: Student of Professor Sherman, researcher, potential decipherer of clues.

concepts.name: Hidden Passage
concepts.context: Secret passage found in Professor Sherman's study.

concepts.name: Graduation Thesis
concepts.context: Jiang Wuwei's thesis on Chinese Taoist mystic culture and world civilizations.

concepts.name: Westport
concepts.context: Location of the first mysterious death and subsequent virus outbreak.

concepts.name: Wise Prophet
concepts.context: Astrologer, victim of the novel virus, found dead with a 'death smile'.

concepts.name: Edgar Cayce
concepts.context: Mentor of the Wise Prophet, known psychic.

concepts.name: Mysterious Death
concepts.context: The peculiar deaths of the Wise Prophet, maid, and police officers.

concepts.name: Novel Virus
concepts.context: The cause of death, leading to a global health crisis.

concepts.name: Hong Kong
concepts.context: Location of the second similar mysterious death and investigation.

concepts.name: Wen Yan
concepts.context: TCM expert, guardian of a secret, victim of the virus in Hong Kong.

concepts.name: Secret
concepts.context: The ancient secret guarded by Wen Yan and her ancestors.

concepts.name: Guardian
concepts.context: Role of Wen Yan and her lineage in protecting a secret.

concepts.name: Interpol
concepts.context: International police organization investigating the cases.

concepts.name: Si Ling
concepts.context: Interpol agent, key investigator of the virus cases.

concepts.name: Feng Zhicheng
concepts.context: Interpol agent, partner of Si Ling.

concepts.name: Death Smile
concepts.context: The peculiar smile left on the faces of the deceased victims.

concepts.name: Cryptic Message
concepts.context: The coded message left by Wen Yan.

concepts.name: Ouyang Mingbo
concepts.context: Renowned archaeologist, husband of Wen Yan, and mentor of Jiang Wuwei.

concepts.name: London
concepts.context: The suspected next location of an outbreak and the destination of the killers.

concepts.name: Virus Immunity/Cure
concepts.context: The intruders claim to have medicine for the virus, and the investigators search for a cure.

main_topics: The Mysterious Deaths and the Novel Virus
hierarchy.structure: The document begins by establishing a historical context of ancient civilizations, then introduces a mysterious death in New York which escalates into a global health crisis. Subsequently, a parallel incident in Hong Kong reveals a connection to an ancient secret, leading to an Interpol investigation that points towards a specific individual and a potential future outbreak in the UK.
